definition: pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
variant of 勾[gou1]
comma/phrase marked by pause
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: As the sentence was read, she collapsed into her lawyer's arms.
sentences.chinese: 由於句讀，她崩潰到她的律師的武器。

definition: to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
pun/play on words
subtle words with profound meaning (idiom)
to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
concise and comprehensive (idiom)
letter/also written 書札|书札
regular script (Chinese calligraphic style)
meaning of a character
a slip of a pen/CL:處|处[chu4]
meaning of a word
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
